events.originalText: Five letters containing anthrax spores were mailed to various media outlets in the United States.
events.subtitle: Anthrax
events.headline: Anthrax spores mailed to US media outlets

events.originalText: While posing as an aristocrat, Belgian serial killer Nestor Pirotte murdered an antiques dealer in Brussels, for which crime he was sentenced to death.
events.subtitle: Nestor Pirotte
events.headline: Belgian serial killer Nestor Pirotte sentenced to death

events.originalText: An aircraft crashed near Ndola in Northern Rhodesia, resulting in the deaths of United Nations secretary-general Dag Hammarskjöld and 15 others on board.
events.subtitle: 1961 Ndola Transair Sweden DC-6 crash
events.headline: Aircraft crash kills Dag Hammarskjöld and 15 others

events.originalText: The Australian cricket team's Invincibles tour of England concluded; they had played 34 matches, including five Tests, without defeat.
events.subtitle: Australia national cricket team
events.headline: Australian cricket team concludes Invincibles tour of England

events.originalText: World War I: The Central Powers' defeat at the Battle of Dobro Pole played a role in the Bulgarian withdrawal from the war and led to the subsequent liberation of Vardar Macedonia.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Battle of Dobro Pole leads to Bulgarian withdrawal from WWI

events.originalText: Daniel David Palmer performed the first chiropractic adjustment, on deaf janitor Harvey Lillard.
events.subtitle: Daniel David Palmer
events.headline: First chiropractic adjustment performed on deaf janitor

events.originalText: The Blackpool Illuminations (example pictured) in the English seaside town of Blackpool were switched on for the first time.
events.subtitle: Blackpool Illuminations
events.headline: Blackpool Illuminations switched on for the first time

events.originalText: The Indianola hurricane dissipated over Mississippi after killing around eight hundred people in Texas.
events.subtitle: 1875 Indianola hurricane
events.headline: Indianola hurricane dissipates after killing hundreds

events.originalText: Panic of 1873: The American bank Jay Cooke & Company declared bankruptcy, setting off a chain reaction of bank failures.
events.subtitle: Panic of 1873
events.headline: Panic of 1873: Jay Cooke & Company declares bankruptcy

events.originalText: Nathaniel P. Langford of the Washburn–Langford–Doane Expedition first observed a geyser in the Wyoming Territory erupting at regular intervals, naming it Old Faithful (video featured).
events.subtitle: Nathaniel P. Langford
events.headline: Old Faithful geyser observed in Wyoming Territory

events.originalText: The New York Times, the largest metropolitan newspaper in the United States, was founded.
events.subtitle: The New York Times
events.headline: New York Times founded as largest US metropolitan newspaper

events.originalText: The United States Congress passed the Fugitive Slave Act, decreeing that all escaped slaves be brought back to their masters.
events.subtitle: United States Congress
events.headline: US Congress passes Fugitive Slave Act

events.originalText: The second Theatre Royal, Covent Garden (interior pictured), opened in London after the original was destroyed by fire.
events.subtitle: Royal Opera House
events.headline: Second Theatre Royal, Covent Garden, opens in London

events.originalText: Byzantine–Seljuk wars: Byzantine forces defeated their Seljuk opponents in the flanks of the nocturnal Battle of Kapetron, but learned of their Georgian allies' defeat in the centre the next morning.
events.subtitle: Byzantine–Seljuk wars
events.headline: Byzantine forces defeat Seljuk opponents in Battle of Kapetron

events.originalText: Constantine the Great decisively defeated Licinius in the Battle of Chrysopolis, establishing Constantine's sole control over the Roman Empire and ending the Tetrarchy.
events.subtitle: Constantine the Great
events.headline: Constantine the Great defeats Licinius in Battle of Chrysopolis

events.originalText: Nerva, the first of the "Five Good Emperors" of ancient Rome, came to power following the assassination of his predecessor Domitian.
events.subtitle: AD 96
events.headline: Nerva becomes Emperor after Domitian's assassination
